intro: Oxystophyllum, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers and silver-gray foliage, which help it thrive in salty, windy environments. The plant belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ability to tolerate harsh maritime conditions. Oxystophyllum typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dunes or along the shoreline. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening in coastal areas.
